title: Technology:  GM Cruise Unit Boss  To Leave Company  ----  By Mike Colias
text:
Dan Ammann, chief executive of General Motors Co.'s Cruise autonomous-vehicle unit, is leaving the company, GM said.

GM said Thursday that Cruise president and founder Kyle Vogt will serve as the division's interim CEO. Mr. Ammann couldn't be reached for comment.

Mr. Ammann led GM's 2016 acquisition of Cruise for $1 billion. The San Francisco company has grown to about 2,000 employees from about 40 and attracted big investors, including SoftBank Group Corp., Microsoft Corp. and Honda Motor Co.
